name: Pixel Defense (lukephilipps)
description:
Gameplay - 

  • Build towers and use your player attack to fend off waves of enemies. 
  • Power up your player by standing still and filling up the MEDITATION meter to level up your attacks. 
  • Save your money to gain interest between rounds, gaining more on a perfect round clear (no enemies make it through).
  • To survive late into the game and even win, risks must be taken by saving money and not utilizing the player attack to become stronger later on.

Menu Controls - 

  • Arrow keys select option.
  • [Z] confirms selection.
  • [X] goes to previous screen.

Game Controls - 

  • Arrow keys move character.
  • [Z] interacts, allowing to place towers, upgrade towers, and confirm menu options.
  • [X] cancels tower placement and menu options.
  • [SPACE] makes your character attack!
  • [ESC] pauses the game.

Features - 

  • Two characters.
  • Four towers, each with a unique MAX level upgrade that changes how it works.
  • Two stages, one more difficult than the other.
  • 50 waves of enemies.
  • Around 40 minutes of gameplay per attempt.

Currently the game features no music, however in a future update multiple tracks may be added. Sound effects are in however and the the volume of them may be adjusted at any time.

This game was designed and produced in a 2 and a half week period using no tutorials, based on a certain tower defense minigame that maybe you can figure out. Thanks for checking it out :)
